definitions.definition: Critical assessment of a process or activity or of their results.
definitions.example: After you hand in your essays, I will give both grades and feedback.

definitions.definition: (control theory) The part of an output signal that is looped back into the input to control or modify a system.
The high-pitched howling noise heard when there is a loop between a microphone and a speaker.
To generate the high-frequency sound by allowing a speaker to cause vibration of the sound generator of a musical instrument connected by an amplifier to the speaker.
definitions.example: The show ended with a riot of feedbacking guitars.
His employees feedbacked him a lot more than he wanted.

definitions.definition: To convey by means of specialized communications channel.
definitions.example: Customers feedbacked their complaints and some praise.
